metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8143 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Samba 4.0.x before 4.0.24, 4.1.x before 4.1.16, and 4.2.x before 4.2rc4, when an Active Directory Domain Controller (AD DC) is configured, allows remote authenticated users to set the LDB userAccountControl UF_SERVER_TRUST_ACCOUNT bit, and consequently gain privileges, by leveraging delegation of authority for user-account or computer-account creation.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8143` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-winbind - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.4
libpam-smbpass - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.4
libpam-winbind - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.4
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.4
libsmbclient - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.4
libsmbsharemodes0 - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.4
libwbclient0 - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.4
python-samba - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.4
registry-tools - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.4
samba - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.4
samba-common - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.4
samba-common-bin - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.4
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.4
samba-libs - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.4
samba-testsuite - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.4
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.4
smbclient - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.4
winbind - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.4').
